schema-common-system-destination-def.description:
Specifies the target IP address or hostname, representing the
endpoint of the traceroute.

schema-common-system-source-def.description:
Specifies the source IP address from which the traceroute
will originate.

schema-common-system-initial-ttl-def.description:
Specifies the initial Time-to-Live (TTL) value for the traceroute,
allowing it to begin from a specified TTL rather than the default
starting at TTL=1.

schema-common-system-max-def.description:
Specifies the maximum TTL (Time-to-Live) value, specifying the
upper limit for the number of hops the trace will attempt,
beyond which the trace will stop.

schema-common-system-wait-def.description:
Specifies the maximum time (in nanoseconds) to wait for a response
from each hop. If this time is exceeded, the hop is considered to
have timed out. (range: 0.1 - 10.0)

schema-common-system-do-not-fragment-def.description:
Activates the "Do Not Fragment" (DF) bit for IPv4, preventing the
packet from being fragmented during transmission.

schema-common-system-l3protocol-def.description:
Specifies the IP version (IPv4 or IPv6) for the traceroute,
determining the addressing scheme.

schema-common-system-l4protocol-def.description:
Specifies the Layer 4 protocol (TCP, UDP, or ICMP) used for the
traceroute, determining the transport layer protocol for communication

schema-common-system-port-def.description:
Specifies the initial destination port:
increments from 33434 for "default" (UDP), starts at 1 for "icmp,"
or defaults to 80 for "tcp" and 53 for "udp

schema-common-system-vrf-def.description:
Specifies the network instance or VRF (Virtual Routing & Forwarding)
context, determining the routing table used for the traceroute
operation.

schema-common-system-interval-def.description: seconds between sending each packet (0.1 to 5)

schema-common-system-size-def.description: Size of the ping packets in bytes

schema-common-system-wait-ping-def.description: Specify the time to wait for a response, with a duration ranging from 0.1 to 10 seconds

schema-common-system-source-ping-def.description: Source IP address for the ping

schema-common-system-do-not-fragment-pin.description: Sets the do not fragment bit for IPv4

schema-common-system-l3protocol-ping-def.description: Layer3 protocol requested for the ping

schema-common-system-vrf-ping-def.description: Network instance to ping the destination in

schema-common-system-source-interface-de.description: source interface requested for the ping

destination.description: Specifies the destination(IPv4/IPv6/Host-name) to check reachability

schema-system-reboot-mode-action-def.description:
System Reboot Modes.
halt   - Shuts down the system.
cold   - Allow a controlled shutdown by notifying all running processes that the system is going down.
immediate   - Reboot system immediately without notifying any running processes.
power-cycle   - Shuts down the system and then powers it back up.
